fr:title.text: Subfield fixed under finite subgroup of automorphisms is a Galois extension

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Subfield fixed under finite subgroup of automorphisms is a Galois extension

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Let \Bbbk be a field and H\leq \mathop {\textrm {Aut}}\nolimits (\Bbbk ) is a finite subgroup. Then \mathop {\textrm {Aut}}\nolimits (\Bbbk / \Bbbk ^{H})=H, and in particular \Bbbk / \Bbbk ^{H} is Galois.

The failure in bijectivity lies in the composition \mathbb {F}\mapsto \mathop {\textrm {Aut}}\nolimits (\Bbbk / \mathbb {F})\mapsto \Bbbk ^{\mathop {\textrm {Aut}}\nolimits (\Bbbk / \mathbb {F})}. But being Galois means this composition is the identity map.
